Faldo Maldini Bicara Soal Perda Syariah untuk Sumatera Barat
01 Nov 2019, 13:54 by Tempo.co, Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ketua Dewan Pimpinan Wilayah Partai Solidaritas Indonesia (PSI) Sumatera Barat Faldo Maldini menyatakan keyakinannya bahwa Peraturan Daerah Syariah di Sumbar tak bertentangan dengan cita-cita partainya.
Menurut Faldo, PSI hanya berusaha mengkritik oknum elite lokal yang hanya membawa-bawa nama agama saja namun tidak menolak keberadaan syariah itu sendiri.
"Setiap orang berhak memeluk kepercayaannya. Ada orang yang ingin berkuasa selamanya, lalu fitnah macam-macam. Sampai bilang, PSI bukan partainya orang Sumbar, ini kan memecah belah," kata Faldo saat dihubungi Tempo, Jum'at 1 November 2019.
Mantan Wakil Sekjen PAN itu mengatakan, ia mendukung semangat syariah yang bisa memberi manfaat untuk perempuan, anak, lingkungan dan alam. Faldo berpendapat tujuan islami yang ia yakini dapat bermanfaat bagi Sumatera Barat.
"Kita ingin Sumangaik Baru untuk Sumbar, bicara perubahan. Orang Sumbar otaknya harus makin pintar, perutnya harus makin kenyang, dompetnya harus makin penuh, hatinya harus makin tentram. Itu juga tujuan syariah yang saya yakini," ujar Faldo.
Faldo Maldini diketahui akan mengikuti Pemilihan Gubernur Sumatera Barat pada 2020. Tapi ia masih terganjal batas usia calon kepala daerah. Dalam UU Pilkada diatur batas minimal usia calon gubernur dan wakil gubernur adalah 30 tahun.
Faldo Maldini mengatakan penetapan calon pada Pilkada 2020 adalah 8 Juli 2020. Saat itu, Faldo masih berusia 29 tahun. Kini ia tengah menggugat aturan batas usia itu ke Mahkamah Konstitusi.

Faldo Maldini Talks About Sharia Regional Regulations for West Sumatra
Nov 01 2019, 13:54 by Tempo.co, Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Chairman of the Regional Leadership Council of the West Sumatra Indonesian Solidarity Party (PSI) Faldo Maldini expressed his belief that the Sharia Regional Regulation in West Sumatra does not conflict with his party's ideals.
According to Faldo, PSI only tried to criticize the local elite who only carried the name of religion but did not reject the existence of sharia itself.
"Everyone has the right to embrace their beliefs. There are people who want to be in power forever, then slander things. To say, PSI is not a West Sumatra party, this is divisive," Faldo said when contacted by Tempo, Friday 1 November 2019.
The former Deputy Secretary General of the PAN said, he supports the spirit of sharia that can benefit women, children, the environment and nature. Faldo believes that the Islamic goal he believes can be beneficial to West Sumatra.
"We want Sumangaik Baru for West Sumatra, talking about change. West Sumatra people have to be more intelligent, their stomachs must be more full, their wallets must be more full, their hearts must be more peaceful. That is also the goal of sharia that I believe in," Faldo said.
Faldo Maldini is known to be participating in the West Sumatra Governor Election in 2020. But he is still hampered by the age limit of regional head candidates. The Election Law stipulates that the minimum age limit for a candidate for governor and deputy governor is 30 years.
Faldo Maldini said the determination of the candidates in the 2020 elections was July 8, 2020. At that time, Faldo was still 29 years old. Now he is suing the age limit rule to the Constitutional Court.

NINDY ASTUTI
